item.title: Oil industry split on climate law protests
item.description: A rift has broken out within the US oil industry over a controversial plan to deploy thousands of workers in so-called “Energy Citizen” rallies protesting against imminent climate legislation

item.title: Global Insight: NHS debate is more heat than light
item.description: As opponents turn their fire on President Obama’s health plan, a gross mis-characterisation of Britain’s tax-funded National Health Service has become the weapon of choice to attack it

item.title: Fall in confidence triggers Wall St sell-off
item.description: US stocks were set to end the week on a disappointing notewith the S&P 500 index dropping below the 1,000 mark after weak data knocked confidence in the economic recovery and dragged equities to their first weekly loss in five

item.title: A rally with troubling aspects
item.description: Markets worldwide are pricing in a lot of good news, worrying analysts who believe this rebound will run out of steam

item.title: GM and Chrysler in different paths to recovery
item.description: The ‘new’ General Motors gallops out of the gate with a slew of announcements and other initiatives, while Chrysler has been relatively silent all but invisible apart from run-of-the-mill sales promotions, writes Bernard Simon

item.title: US industrial production climbs in July
item.description: Industrial production increased in July for the second time in over a year and a half and US prices remained flat, marking an upbeat ending to a mostly disappointing week in economic data

item.title: Qatar in €7bn Porsche-VW move
item.description: the The dynasty behind Porsche agreed to sell a 10 per cent voting stake to the Qatar Holding, opening up the sports car maker to outside investors as the first step towards leading to a planned merger with Volkswagen

item.title: Hong Kong rebounds with 3.3% GDP boost
item.description: Hong Kong unexpectedly reported strong second-quarter growth on Friday after a year of contraction, in a fresh sign that the global economic crisis could be coming to an end

item.title: Spanish growth data disappoint
item.description: There were scant signs of green shoots in Spainas official data showed the economy still starved of consumer demand and deep in recession, in contrast to the recoveries in Germany and France

item.title: Venezuela in $50m Antigua aid package
item.description: Antigua, the tiny twin-island nation rocked by allegations of a massive fraud committed on its shores by one of its chief benefactors, Sir Allen Stanford, has received a helping hand from Hugo Chávez
